publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4321 Shona Robison: World Asthma Day—That the Parliament recognises that 2 May 2006 is World Asthma Day; understands that there are 390,000 sufferers of this illness in Scotland; recognises that these sufferers are not automatically entitled to free prescriptions despite having a chronic illness; calls on the Scottish Executive to immediately abolish prescription charges for those with chronic health conditions and cancer and thereafter to phase out charges for everyone else in Scotland, and notes that this charging goes against the founding principles of the NHS and is ultimately a tax on ill-health.
S2M-4321 World Asthma Day (lodged on 2 May 2006) Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*
S2M-4321 World Asthma Day (lodged on 2 May 2006) Michael Matheson*

S2M-4321 Shona Robison: World Asthma Day—That the Parliament recognises that 2 May 2006 is World Asthma Day; understands that there are 390,000 sufferers of this illness in Scotland; recognises that these sufferers are not automatically entitled to free prescriptions despite having a chronic illness; calls on the Scottish Executive to immediately abolish prescription charges for those with chronic health conditions and cancer and thereafter to phase out charges for everyone else in Scotland, and notes that this charging goes against the founding principles of the NHS and is ultimately a tax on ill-health. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Michael Matheson
S2M-4321 World Asthma Day (lodged on 2 May 2006) Fiona Hyslop*
